recommendations: Proceed with CT Pulmonary Angiography (CTPA) for PE evaluation, implementing a comprehensive renal protection protocol and hemodynamic optimization.
If CTPA is contraindicated or hemodynamics cannot be stabilized, consider a Ventilation-Perfusion (V/Q) scan as an alternative for PE assessment.
Adjust contrast volume and hydration based on patient's weight and clinical status, prioritizing safety and efficacy.
Ensure correct application of renal safety metrics and logging of patient height/weight for future reference.
rationale: Patient's presentation suggests high suspicion for PE, making contrast-enhanced CTA the preferred modality if feasible.
Moderate renal impairment and hypotension necessitate careful pre-imaging management including hydration and hemodynamic stabilization.
Weight-based contrast dosing and tailored hydration are critical for optimizing contrast opacification and minimizing renal/cardiac strain.
Accurate documentation of patient biometrics and adherence to current renal safety guidelines are paramount.

protocol_selection.name: CT Pulmonary Angiography (Chest CTA for PE)
protocol_selection.description: CT angiography timed for pulmonary arterial phase (6–13 sec post-contrast) to evaluate pulmonary arteries for embolism.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Weight-based; ~1.5 mL/kg, maximum 100 mL iodinated contrast (300 mg I/mL); follow ACR Manual and specific patient weight.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Assess renal risk with eGFR; implement hydration and hemodynamic optimization per recommendations. Contrast volume (mL) should be <= (eGFR x 1.5) for low-risk patients, adjust for moderate risk and clinical context.
